abstract: Six Baltimore police officers charged in death of black man Freddie Gray ask Maryland judge for change of venue for their trial; 85-page motion states officers' case that sense of racial injustice and suspicions of police misconduct, which have led to widespread unrest in Baltimore, would make selection of an impartial jury nearly impossible.
lead_paragraph: The six police officers have asked a Maryland judge for a change of venue from Baltimore, where suspicions of police misconduct provoked both violent unrest and days of peaceful demonstrations.

headline.main: Baltimore Officers Charged in Freddie Gray’s Death Seek to Move Trial
headline.print_headline: In Baltimore, Officers Seek to Move Trial

snippet: The six police officers have asked a Maryland judge for a change of venue from Baltimore, where suspicions of police misconduct provoked both violent unrest and days of peaceful demonstrations.
